website_summaries.verdict: A favorite of experienced anglers, this is a very good backup rod that’s forgiving to the newbie as well.
pros: Works well with a variety of lures
Fast action that’s good for trout, but not too whippy
Hook holder at the base of the rod
cons: Action and overall performance may frustrate some experienced users

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rod as a backup rod due to the reviews. I don't normally write reviews but this rod deserves recognition. I've been flyfishing for 60 years and i have mostly sage rods with different lower end backups or beaters. I would highly recommend this rod as a good affordable backup rod for accomplished flyfisherman and would be a wise choice for a beginner or intermediate. You cannot find a better rod for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Norman

customer_reviews.title: Thankfully I was in for a surprise because what I got was actually a pretty decent fly rod
customer_reviews.text: Broke my Orvis Clearwater and needed a fast replacement while it was being repaired. Bought this guy on a whim mostly because of price, and didn't expect much accordingly. Thankfully I was in for a surprise because what I got was actually a pretty decent fly rod. Performs just as well as my Orvis for a fraction of the cost. Not even going to mention the few shortcomings of this item because you shouldn't expect perfection for $50 dollars shipped. I would absolutely give Maxcatch more business.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: The Best Budget Rod!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe a rod built with an IM6 blank is this cheap! I am a guide and this rod casts & fights fish nearly as well as my high-ends. The fit and finish are surprisingly well done. I'm picky but I really enjoy fishing this rod. Feel: fast, firm, loads well for advanced casters but is flexi enough to not snap tippets or tear out hooks. Lots of backbone = big bug long distance caster and puts heavy fish in the net fast. You will have to spend a LOT more to do better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Quint T. Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: The TFO for 125 is the best for the money
customer_reviews.text: I fish an Orvis Recon and TFO. No, it is not on par. But it is very light and fishes well. It seems the blank is just uniform and dependent in diamter alone for bend resistance unlike tuned rods. The TFO for 125 is the best for the money. But at this price I will keep some around for guests!
customer_reviews.author: The skinny...Top Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: exceeded expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fly fishermen for over 16 years. I own rods that are $1,200 and $200 and everywhere in between. ive never tried a rod this affordable but I must say I expected it to look cheap and feel as inexpensive as it is. but NO! this rod looks nice and feels nice. I know there are better rods out there but this is well worth the money. great job MAXCATCH! perfect for beginners, and satisfactory for any skill level.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice, Affordable Trout/Panfish Fly Rod
customer_reviews.text: Dollar for dollar, this is a great affordable fly rod. Gorgeous matt forest green, decent reel seat, casts well, moderate action rod...good loops at 50' with decent accuracy...feels nice in hand. Great beginner trout or panfish rod. Maxcatch is a good seller and provided quick shipping too.
customer_reviews.author: R C G

customer_reviews.title: Good quality great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a pretty nice rod. It has a good action and for the price you can't beat it. It's not an orvis or sage but it is a fraction of the cost. Company has great customer service as well. Mine got slammed in a door I explained that to the company they still sent a new top free of charge. I would definitely buy from them again
customer_reviews.author: Jim D

customer_reviews.title: I do a lot of trout fishing and love this rod
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of trout fishing and love this rod. I just used it a week up in Colorado. For the money this is a high-quality rod and if you end up breaking it not a big deal because the price is right. I have a $400 flyrod that I don’t think is any better than this one. I plan on buying another one just to have as a back up in case I break my good run definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice feeling, good casting rod
customer_reviews.text: i bought the 9'6" 5wt rod. I was replacing an older fenwick i had that was stolen, and honestly this rod performs just as well costing under 1/2 the amount. it has a nice Fast action, and throws the line well even with larger fly's (wooly buggers, small poppers, etc.). if your looking for a lower price fly rod that works well thi is it.
customer_reviews.author: Savlaka

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish is pretty good. Metal reel seat cork grips. Looks decent actually. Casting is pretty good I’m using a rocket taper 5wt line and this thing casts great. The multi piece construction makes it slightly heavier than a two piece rod, but it’s so minor you won’t notice. It also tracks well and has plenty of power. It’s slighty lacking in terms of stiffness and sensitivity but it’s worth it for the convenience. My only two concerns are the lack of a carrying case and strength. I haven’t landed anything on it bigger than about twelve inches. I do wonder how it’ll hold up if I hook into something bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S.

customer_reviews.title: I really like the action on this pole- pretty fast but not ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the action on this pole- pretty fast but not annoyingly so, a great trout rod. I actually had a Sage 4 piece I loved that was stolen out of my car years ago and I could never bring myself to replace it- I just quit fly fishing for ~10 years. Do I love this $45 rod as much as I loved that ~$500 one? You know, given that if it gets stolen or broken I won't be heartbroken, I think I actually prefer the Maxcatch- no lie. It casts and fishes great, wish I could have bought this 10 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: I used this "flipping" for reds over the last 10 days. It worked really well. I got it in 10 weight since I planned to pull in some kings but did not get the chance to try it out. My only complaint is that the nuts for tightening on the reel didn't want to stay tight unless I cranked them down pretty good. A minor issue for the money saved.
customer_reviews.author: JTG

customer_reviews.title: You will like this rod even if you don’t want to
customer_reviews.text: So I wanted to fish this a few times before writing this review, and I gotta say, I don’t hate this rod. It’s a tad bit stiffer than my last 3wt that I broke but it loads and casts pretty well for a cheap “throw away” rod. Is it like Sage or any high end rod? Nope. What it does do though is come very close to the mid range rods for a quarter of the price. My favorite thing about this rod is the length, it’s longer than most non nymphing 3wts on the market and it mends very well. Is it gonna replace your 200 rod? Nope, but it will fish very nicely until then. Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor B

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod and a great bargain.
customer_reviews.text: This rod has a nice action (medium fast) and is well finished. This is a great bargain and you can't go wrong as a gift for a beginner or as an extra rod for an advanced caster. I always carry an extra rod as a backup. In this case I bought this rod because I wanted a 4 weight. It is great with either a 4 wt sink tip or 5 wt floating.
customer_reviews.author: L. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I now almost exclusively use Maxcatch products for all my 'backup' rods, reels, line and other gear in case the primary (far more expensive) equipment becomes unusable on a day's fishing. Sure, there are better rods and reels out there, but you'll be paying 20 times as much, for something that's only twice as good. For quality-to-price ratio, Maxcatch provides the ultimate in good value.
customer_reviews.author: Debonair Caveman

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality, craftsmanship and value!!!
customer_reviews.text: The action of this light rod and line is perfect to deliver with accuracy and distance. I’m 84 and 65+years ago I owned a Philipson split bamboo rod, your rod:line combo takes me back to my experiences then. Thank you Jessie in customer service for your help and followup in resolving a damaging mistake I made.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Madison

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful rod
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rod for the money. Loads the line very well and easily able to cast dries 60+ feet. The deep green finish is beautiful! My only suggestion would be to include a more standard rod case instead of the clear plastic case.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Great rod.  Hands down - great value -  casts really well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good buy for the money. It casts extreemly well out to 72 feet, and is reliably accurate (given this anglers ability). It is stiff and strong. The 4wt casts best with a line weight .5 to one wt heavier. Excells at roll casting. I could roll cast further than i can with way more expensive rods. Plenty of lifting and fighting power. Caught a dozzen panfish and bass over weekend.
customer_reviews.author: BSA256

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: Keeping the low price in mind while I write this review, I think it's a decent value overall. It is very stiff/fast and not at all sensitive and the cork grip and shape of it feel very cheap. However, the 4wt 8'6" does cast fairly well for a small rod. It's a pretty good choice for a backup rod and won't you have stroke if it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Shank Wheat

customer_reviews.title: reel base is flipped backwards
customer_reviews.text: The whole package is impressive, lots of gear for the money. However, the reel base or reel seat has a huge flaw. Its flipped backwards (see photo). I checked into the return but the postage to send back was greater than the cost of the kit. Yesterday, I reached out to the seller, haven't heard back. Honestly i'm still impressed with the kit, i think i can fix the flaw. Unfortunately i will need to order some parts from a rod building company and somehow pull apart the handle. Word to the wise, always review return policy or at least understand the risk.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Wilford

customer_reviews.title: Great rod.
customer_reviews.text: The most expensive rod that I use is $200. I can’t tell the difference between the two. The only regret would be not buying the combo. If you only need a rod, this one is great. I have not tested their warranty but it seems like it’s a good warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Griffin P

customer_reviews.title: The seller's contact information it's a fake
customer_reviews.text: I was enjoying the fishing at the Kenai river in Alaska when the rod broke while fish on. Trying to contact the company in China was just a waste of time. Calls and massages without no respond, the seller's contact information it's a fake. I know the product was cheap and didn't think was going to last. But giving it one year warranty on the rod and they should stand behind it.
customer_reviews.author: Eli98AK

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod- don't plan on keeping the case.
customer_reviews.text: The rod is very nice and casts well. Great action and good distance. Just don't expect to be happy with the case it comes in. I was planning on storing it in the case, but it is pretty much garbage. I can't fault the rod for the case however, so the rod still gets 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun M. Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: its really a fine rod for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been fly fishing for about 40 years. I'm not an elitists; I really only care about performance. That being said (and the fact that I have only fished with this rod once), its really a fine rod for the price. Good sensitivity, very light, the cork is good, and power is fine. Hard to believe you can purchase a rod like this for $40.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Good to know
customer_reviews.text: Love the blank and the way it loads - eyes attached well and finish is good- I have a couple of the value rods from MaxCatch - the one thing that do not like is the reel seat - almost impossible to tighten the rings enough to properly secure reel foot without reel slipping / rotating on tube. Not a real issue if bass fishing in ponds but not good for big saltwater fish. On the whole good value rod.
customer_reviews.author: DouG wimberly

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a decent quality fly rod for the cost. Line guides are the appropriate size and nice grip diameter. Update 4/18/2020: The rod performs well but the cork grip is loose and sqeaks when casting.
customer_reviews.author: ACM1057

customer_reviews.title: Can't fish with a broken rod
customer_reviews.text: Did not get 10 casts in prior to rod breaking. With all the good reviews, I assume this is just a manufacturing issue with a specific lot. I am in contact with the manufacturer to get a replacement or my money back. Regardless of resolution, my review will stay at 1 star. Pretty new to fly fishing so I did not have a backup rod for the trip I took this rod on. Size is a 4wt, 8"6", 4 piece.
customer_reviews.author: freakyboy

customer_reviews.title: Good value as a back-up rod.
customer_reviews.text: Actually throws a line better than I expected. Bought as a spare for use by friends who want to try fly fishing. Reluctant to have them use expensive gear until they show capability.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a Brinkworth at half the cost.
customer_reviews.text: This is my float tube rod. I don't want to risk my Winston B3x and expensive reel if I drop it. Bought a Brinkworth that had the reel seat on backwards, noticed a few days after the return window, and was totally useless. Ebay and Paypal lost my account over that.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: well built, great price
customer_reviews.text: Theres no reason NOT to buy this rod. I purchased this rod to be sent to my vacation destination so i wouldnt have to pack one on my flight. It is built very well and i really do enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: BBI tackle

customer_reviews.title: Very good casting and action
customer_reviews.text: I have the 8 Wt, 9 Ft rod which I'm using for Bass and Pike. This is a very good casting rod, quick action. Casts big streamers, larger Bass poppers, as well as the smaller streamers very well. Caught several decent sized Bass and smaller (18 - 26") Pike on it so far and have been very pleased with this rod so far. I'm looking forward to next spring when I can get back out on the ponds. I'll probably pick up another one in the 5-6 Wt range for pan fish/trout/bass rod.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WOULD NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE USED THIS TWICE AND THE TIP HAS ALREADY BROKEN OFF OF IT. I WOULD LIKE IT REPLACED, BUT DONT SEE IT HAPPENING. ONLY HAD IT 6 WEEKS
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and flexible yet still has backbone. Hard to beat for the money. I’d compare it to a “big name” mid-tier rod. I only bought the rod and added my own reel. It casts drys and nymphs well. Too light for bigger streamers but can handle smaller ones. I’ll buy another one in a larger size for streamers.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful fishing rod
customer_reviews.text: Perfect weight and action for the stream and small alpine lake fishing I do. This replaced a very old fiberglass rod that had been around for @45 years so it was well past time for an updated rod.
customer_reviews.author: Lee E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice 3wt
customer_reviews.text: Great 3wt rod for small rivers/streams. Makes an 8" trout feel like an 18 incher! I use a weighted forward 5wt line and 6x tapered leader. Swings small drys nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Nice flex and easy to assemble. Like the case included too. Just with it came in a five section for better storage in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Chaffey

customer_reviews.title: Casts well.
customer_reviews.text: I find that my 4wt rod casts better with a 5wt line. Long and accurate casts even in a stiff breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Pesky

customer_reviews.title: Broke first day
customer_reviews.text: Priced right, but had an eyelet brake first day. Would recommended just buying a better rod.
customer_reviews.author: bass-fish-37

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking rod
customer_reviews.text: This rod works well to hike in and set up. Good action. Affordability is key.
customer_reviews.author: flapsfisher

customer_reviews.title: Just what a beginner needed
customer_reviews.text: I was heading to a north Georgia trout river and needed a fly rod. This fit the bill perfectly. Overall it was a good value for the money and of nice quality. I would’nt hesitate to buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Weisbrodt

customer_reviews.title: What a great rod! For the price
customer_reviews.text: What a great rod! For the price, you cannot beat it! I have handled some pretty big largemouth bass, cat fish (it was a strange thing catching a cat fish on the top-water popper haha), and even carp. This rod was fantastic last season, and I am looking forward to catching some personal best this upcoming bass season!
customer_reviews.author: Al L. Stelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: High quality rod! Just about the best you can get for $40.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Ming

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This worked like a dream. Added an extra 25 ft. To my cast. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor G.

customer_reviews.title: Love the rod (until I broke the tip , my fault)
customer_reviews.text: I love the rod I have had it for a few months , unfortunately I snapped the tip off (my fault) does anyone know if I can get a replacement piece for the rod ? I’d hate to order a whole new one . While I had the rod in working order it performed perfectly .
customer_reviews.author: jonny k

customer_reviews.title: Being able to control the placing of the fly one day
customer_reviews.text: I like the light weight I am learning to fly fish
customer_reviews.author: Lemuel G.

customer_reviews.title: Great rod
customer_reviews.text: My husband and brother in law just love these rods
customer_reviews.author: carolyn osborne

customer_reviews.title: Really nice quality and responsive flyrod
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a few high end flyrods and bought this for one of my kids. You cannot buy a better rod for the money. The finish is nice, the action is great.
customer_reviews.author: The Shramp

customer_reviews.title: One more cast...
customer_reviews.text: I use this rod for smallmouth ass in river systems. Can't beat it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good inexpensive rod, be careful with the tip, it may break
customer_reviews.author: eugene spektor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money. Guides tell me an up and coming brand.
customer_reviews.author: judy a moorehead

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks just like my TFO, bt cost a lot less.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great looking feeling and casting Rods
customer_reviews.text: Great looking feeling and casting Rods. I have both a 4 and a 7. The 4 is definitely a 4 wt the 7 more like. 7.5 or light 8. Planning on using the 7 for bonefish
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp color
customer_reviews.text: Very fetching color scheme on this rod- cork grips are kinda dry, but more than acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Ferf

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice, Simple Fly Rod
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned with the low price on this fly rod as most are priced much higher. I am living in a tight budget and based on the other reviews decided to risk the purchase. I'm very pleased all the way around. My inspection of the design and craftsmanship prove it is a quality fly rod for a great price. The packaging is superb and I'm excited to go out and put it to use.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Grover

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t been able to use it yet but very well built from what I can tell
customer_reviews.author: joshua s.

customer_reviews.title: One very happy satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and communication with the company and top-quality rods at a very affordable price Highly recommend this company and quality gear
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Just go for it.
customer_reviews.text: Just buy it, the material and the balance of the rod are amazing, if you're new to Fly Fishing just go for it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Legend

customer_reviews.title: Ultra Light Rod
customer_reviews.text: extremely light pole. Even though the picture shows this rod to be blue, mine was green, which I prefer. Would be nice if this came with a tote bag rather than a plastic tube.
customer_reviews.author: akbear

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this pole and says it's the best one he now owns. The family loves fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Rajagray

customer_reviews.title: Unusuable as a 5wt fly rod
customer_reviews.text: This rod is way too stiff and heavy to be a 5wt fly rod It felt more like casting with a pool cue. The returns policy allowed me to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great starter rod/kit.
customer_reviews.text: Novice fly fisherman but the seems to be a great starts kit. Have practiced casting and done some lake fishing, so far with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Boback

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fly rod.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this fly rod as a Christmas gift for my husbands father. He absolutely loves it. The storage case is great.
customer_reviews.author: CaseyV

customer_reviews.title: 3 wt fly rod
customer_reviews.text: I have fished for two days with the fly rod, it is excellent light weight and does not wear me out. I’m 100% percent satisfied with the new fly rod
customer_reviews.author: Dale Alber

customer_reviews.title: A fine rod at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This 4-piece travel rod is exactly what I was looking for. The action is fast and the rod manages larger fish well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good rod super lightweight love it
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Just fine for travel.
customer_reviews.text: We use this (and others) when traveling...stiff enough to get the line out ... plenty of explosion for the mountain streams we go to.. I use a different carrying case that fits some others I bring...the case this comes in...is sort of eh......
customer_reviews.author: Randy D

customer_reviews.title: Good rod for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good rod for the $ landed a nice steelhead the other day on it. Only con is it could be a little lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew r.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was wonderful to cast and the workmanship was great.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Battle Tested
customer_reviews.text: Launched a few poppers on a local pond. It felt like I had bluefish on the end of my line.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This fly rod is great, I bought the 8 weight along with a Pflueger Trion 1978. Great match.
customer_reviews.author: TexasDPL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice rod, thought it came with a reel. My bad
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rod. Very high quality feeling rod and delivery was on time and in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: looks good have not gone fishing with it
customer_reviews.text: looks good have not gone fishing with it. got it as a spare rod for fishing tarpon in Mexico. if you don't have a backup rod your 1 short
customer_reviews.author: Art Brown

customer_reviews.title: You cannot get a decent fly rod at these prices.  Quality is good.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. Nice finish on the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am glad i listened to the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly impressed. I am glad i listened to the reviews. Had success 1st time out, nice looking Trout.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great rod, new favorite already
customer_reviews.text: Used it yesterday catching trout on the Elk River Tn , for being as small as it was it sure had some back bone. Great rod, new favorite already
customer_reviews.author: William T.

customer_reviews.title: Over the rainbow trout!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, arrived super fast and I caught a beautiful rainbow trout on my second outing with this rod! Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Imelda Marcos

customer_reviews.title: Exception value
customer_reviews.text: Quality of this rod compares or exceeds a lot of expensive rods costing many times more. My 8 wt saltwater reel locks down solid on the machined reel seat. Grip and fighting butt cork are perfect and the right lengths. Guides and wraps are perfect, ferule fit and strength are excellent. The action with a Tropical, Salt Water Taper floating line is smooth with a quick recovery, this thing throws line! My only complaint is that the quality of the deep green blank is just too perfect to subject to fishing abuse.
customer_reviews.author: hateguns

customer_reviews.title: Impressive rod!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice rod for the price..... I wanted a 4 piece rod, saw this one and thought "what the hell, the price is right!" When it came I was very impressed.... much more then I thought for the price. I showed it to a friend and wound up ordering a 4 wt. for him. Mine is a 3wt..... Now I have a 4wt. on the way
customer_reviews.author: John C.  Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Handles great
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 4W rod. Love it! Handles great. Matched it with a Pfleuger Automatic reel and very happy with the combo. The rod has a nice feel holding, casting and retrieving. Caught some small panfish and was a lot of fun. I previously bought a 7W Maxcatch rod and was very satisfied with. A fly fishing pro I know tried the 7W and was very impressed. Very pleased also with the Maxcatch fly lines. You do not have to buy expensive equipment to fly fish and be successful. Maxcatch is my "go to" brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E. White

customer_reviews.title: Their customer support is fantastic. The rod is great and the reel works ...
customer_reviews.text: We had an issue with the reel when it arrived, but the seller were very fast to help us out after an email. Their customer support is fantastic. The rod is great and the reel works very well. I would recommend this product and using this seller. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great quality a great price
customer_reviews.text: I started to fly fish this year, and did not want to invest a lot of money in a rod. I am using the 6 weight rod with a Landon reel, and the balance and feel are great. The rod's flex is good and it is easy to cast. I love the metal reel seat, and th.e cork handle is comfortable. I am planning on purchasing a 3 or 4 weight rod fir when I need a more delicate presentation. I will defiantly be purchasing another Maxcatch.
customer_reviews.author: Barrett Johnson

customer_reviews.title: nice quality material
customer_reviews.text: Fly fishing is my new hobby. Did a lots of research in the big stores and online as well. So realized that fly fishing can get really expensive. So i ordered the 9' with 8 weight. Product shipped fast, the fishing rod was packed very well in a box and a special tube to protect all the 4 parts of the rod. First impression was that is well protected, nice quality material, cork handles ,extremely light, the slot for the reel is easy to attach. Performance is great already tried great action. So overall great price, great quality and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Radoslav B.

customer_reviews.title: Rod weight is inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Just received my 9’ 10 wt, which is labeled as a 9’ 10 wt but is actually a 9’ 7/8wt.😡. Good construction and cosmetically satisfactory. I’m returning immediately and ordering from a company that knows what a 10 weight rod is.
customer_reviews.author: acromp16

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: beautiful rod! I lhave not used it yet, but it is very nice balanced well. would buy another!
customer_reviews.author: lonny feickert

customer_reviews.title: I love this rod
customer_reviews.text: I got this rod 6 month ago and I love it. It really is 3 rods in 1. You can use a spook and switch out, and use a trick worm all on the same rod, plus the Carrying case is great for traveling. It is hard and it is durable and you can use it for any 2 piece rod. I highly recommend getting this rod it really is a amazing deal for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Isabelle Delafosse

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: I broke the top on the first large fish I caught. I only gave it a 2 star maybe mine was just defective and all rest are good but I will buy nice ones only now. Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Joshuashely

customer_reviews.title: Great feeling fly rod
customer_reviews.text: Great feeling fly rod. It feels like it has a little bit slower action to me which I was very pleased with! All my other rods are medium fast. I find the slower action rods are easier to cast with. Very well made product. No blemishes to speak of. Cork grip feels very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene haynes

customer_reviews.title: Good spec., good price for 5 weight fly rod.
customer_reviews.text: Exellent fly rod. It's really lightweight and it has highly strength. Also good length to moving. Thanks for Maxcatch makes these product.
customer_reviews.author: Byungho Park

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: got three, one for my sons and one for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: N O T  G O O D .
customer_reviews.text: This rod is not good. I ordered the explorer, and received one called extreme. It is supposedly a 3 wt, but is stiffer than my 6wt tfo Mangrove. I am returning mine.
customer_reviews.author: samuel Kenny

customer_reviews.title: It's like Christmas every new rod..!!
customer_reviews.text: Only just out of the box , but looks great very light ought to be very sensitive. I'll let you know...
customer_reviews.author: STEVE PARKER

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad for fathers day he love's it. going to get mine next month.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: You need this rod!
customer_reviews.text: I've just gotten into fly fishing this last year so I was just doing a lot of research on what to get for equipment and what sizes of fly rods I would need and so on and so forth! I am fishing for stream trout usually and decided to go with this rod as it had pretty good reviews and came with a case! And I am so happy I did! It's nice a and light and when you put the pieces together...they stay together! This is yet another great product from a company that cares about quality! Highly recommend! I have since also tried bass and even sunfish and this pole is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Red Chameleon

customer_reviews.title: handles the stress
customer_reviews.text: Caught a 24 inch rainbow trout and several around 20 inches, no problems at all! Nice rod for the price. Excellent back up rod.
customer_reviews.author: rita martinez

product_meta.title: M MAXIMUMCATCH Maxcatch Extreme Graphite Fly Fishing Rod 4-Piece 9 Feet IM6 Carbon Blank, Hard Chromed Guides(3/4/5/6/7/8/10wt)
feature_bullets: DESIGNED for a PREMIUM ENTRY LEVEL AT AN OUTSTANDING ATTRACTIVE PRICE - a high quality blank, using the best available components for this price, the rod just feels like most rods twice or triple of the price. Best choice for the young guys to get into fly fishing and also works reliably for the experienced angler for a back-up rod. We just want to make fly fishing simple and affordable.

EXCLUSIVE MAXLINQ BLANK TECHNOLOGY – Pure IM7 24T plus 30T carbon fiber. With mixed 5 layers of carbon including Reinforced Muscle carbon layer for at least 20% increase in strength.the high performance blank will prove the quality is not only associate with high dollar price tags, the highest performance to price ratio

DISTANCE and PRESENTATION – a fast action design rod blank to excel in distance and presentation. Loading easily for long casts into the wind. Slim taper engineered to be smooth and powerful, all for easy long distance casting. Making it easier for new guys getting in to fly fishing to become a high frequent fly fisher.

HIGH STANDARD SMOOTH GUIDES – MaxSelect Stripping Guides and Ultra lightweight Hard Chromed stainless steel snake guides and Over-sized tip loop for smoothest longer casting. PURE CORK HANDL and REEL SEAT – Pure A+ Contoured Cork Handle for comfortable gripping and also helpful for casting. High Density machined aluminum reel seat with two up-locking rings for reliable fixing of the reel foot. And will tolerate saltwater environment.

ONE-YEAR-WARRANTY and LifeTime Repairing Warranty - MAXCATCH as a 15 years fly rod factory,offer “No Hassle” warranty for all our rods for one year. If you are not 100% satisfied with our rod, you can return it in any time. And we also offer lifetime repairing for All Maxcatch rods.
